upload.title: Document Management
upload.subtitle: Upload your documents easily and ask questions based on them.
upload.dragDrop: Drag & drop a file here, or click to select
upload.supportedTypes: Supported files: PDF, HTML, TXT, MD, JPEG, PNG
upload.confirmDelete: Are you sure you want to delete {{filename}}?
upload.invalidFileType: Invalid file type. Please upload a supported file format.

info.title: How Document Upload Works
info.introText: The Document Upload feature allows you to add your own documents to the AI assistant's knowledge base. Once uploaded, you can ask questions about your documents and get accurate, context-aware answers.
info.step1Text: Drag and drop a file into the upload area or click to select a file from your computer. The system accepts various document formats.
info.step2Text: Your document is securely stored and processed. The system extracts text content, identifies images, and prepares the document for indexing.
info.step3Text: The extracted content is split into chunks and converted into vector embeddings. This allows the AI to understand the semantic meaning of your content.
info.step4Text: Once indexed, your document becomes part of your personal knowledge base. You can now ask questions in the chat and receive answers based on your uploaded content.
info.formatsText: The system supports a wide variety of document formats:
info.feature1: Personal knowledge base - Your documents are only accessible to you
info.feature2: Drag and drop upload - Easy and intuitive file upload
info.feature3: Multiple formats - Support for documents, text files, and images
info.feature4: Instant availability - Documents are ready for questions immediately after processing
info.privacyText: Your uploaded documents are stored securely and are only accessible to you. Documents are processed in compliance with data protection regulations. You can delete your documents at any time, which removes them from both storage and the search index.

playground.title: RAG Playground
playground.subtitle: Experiment with Retrieval-Augmented Generation parameters to optimize your AI assistant

sections.responseDescription: Configure how the AI generates and delivers responses to your questions.
sections.searchDescription: Fine-tune how the system searches and retrieves relevant information from your knowledge base.
sections.llmDescription: Adjust the behavior and creativity of the underlying language model.
sections.testInterfaceDescription: Test your parameter configuration by sending a question to the RAG system. The response will be displayed below along with debug information.

explanations.streaming: When enabled, responses appear word-by-word as they are generated, providing a more interactive experience. Disable for complete responses delivered all at once.
explanations.followupQuestions: The AI will suggest relevant follow-up questions based on your conversation, helping you explore topics more deeply.
explanations.agenticRetrieval: Uses an intelligent agent to plan and execute multiple search queries, improving the quality of retrieved information for complex questions.
explanations.agenticReasoningEffort: Controls how much reasoning the retrieval agent uses when planning searches. Higher effort can find more relevant information but takes longer.
explanations.webSource: Augments your knowledge base with real-time web search results, useful for current events or topics not in your documents.
explanations.sharePointSource: Includes content from your connected SharePoint sites alongside your indexed documents.
explanations.searchScore: Sets the minimum relevance score for search results. Higher values return only the most relevant matches, while lower values include more results.
explanations.retrieveCount: The number of document chunks to retrieve from the knowledge base. More chunks provide more context but may slow down responses.
explanations.rerankerScore: Minimum score from the semantic reranker (0-4 scale). Higher values ensure only the most semantically relevant results are used.
explanations.semanticRanker: Uses AI to re-rank search results based on semantic meaning, improving relevance beyond keyword matching.
explanations.semanticCaptions: Extracts the most relevant sentences from documents instead of using full chunks, providing more focused context to the AI.
explanations.queryRewriting: Automatically rewrites your question to improve search results, especially helpful for conversational or ambiguous queries.
explanations.queryAnswer: Extracts direct answers from documents using semantic understanding. Requires semantic ranker to be enabled.
explanations.retrievalMode: Choose how documents are searched: Hybrid combines keyword and semantic search, Vectors uses only semantic similarity, Text uses only keyword matching.
explanations.vectorK: Number of nearest neighbors to retrieve during vector search. Higher values cast a wider net but may include less relevant results.
explanations.includeCategory: Filter search results to only include documents from specific categories.
explanations.excludeCategory: Filter out documents from specific categories in search results.
explanations.temperature: Controls response creativity. Lower values (0.0-0.3) produce focused, consistent answers. Higher values (0.7-1.0) generate more creative, varied responses.
explanations.seed: Set a specific seed number for reproducible responses. Using the same seed with identical inputs will produce similar outputs.
explanations.maxResponseTokens: Maximum number of tokens in the AI's response. Higher values allow longer responses but increase cost and latency.
explanations.topP: Nucleus sampling parameter. Lower values (0.1-0.5) make responses more focused, higher values (0.9-1.0) allow more diverse word choices.
explanations.frequencyPenalty: Reduces repetition by penalizing tokens based on how often they appear. Positive values discourage repetition, negative values encourage it.
explanations.presencePenalty: Encourages the model to explore new topics. Positive values promote topic diversity, negative values keep responses focused on existing topics.
explanations.stopSequences: Comma-separated sequences that will stop the AI's response when encountered. Useful for controlling response format.
explanations.reasoningEffort: Controls how much the model 'thinks' before responding. Higher effort produces more thorough answers but takes longer.
explanations.promptTemplate: Customize the instructions given to the AI. Use '>>>' at the start to append to the default prompt instead of replacing it.
explanations.textSources: Include text content from retrieved documents as context for the AI's response.
explanations.imageSources: Include images from retrieved documents as visual context for the AI's response.

placeholders.promptTemplate: Enter custom instructions for the AI...

info.title: How the RAG Playground Works
info.introText: The RAG Playground is your experimentation space for fine-tuning how the AI assistant retrieves and generates responses. Here you can adjust parameters to optimize the balance between accuracy, creativity, and performance.
info.ragText: RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) combines the power of large language models with your organization's knowledge base. When you ask a question, the system first searches for relevant information in your documents, then uses that context to generate accurate, grounded responses.
info.responseText: These settings control how the AI delivers its answers:
info.responseItem1: Streaming - See responses appear word-by-word for a more interactive experience
info.responseItem2: Follow-up Questions - Get AI-suggested questions to explore topics deeper
info.searchText: These settings determine how the system finds relevant information from your knowledge base:
info.retrievalModeItem1: Hybrid - Combines keyword and semantic search for best results (recommended)
info.retrievalModeItem2: Vectors - Uses only semantic similarity to find conceptually related content
info.retrievalModeItem3: Text - Uses only keyword matching for precise term searches
info.semanticText: The semantic ranker uses AI to re-rank search results based on meaning, not just keywords. Semantic captions extract the most relevant sentences from documents for more focused context.
info.agenticText: When enabled, an intelligent agent plans and executes multiple search queries to find the best information for complex questions. This improves recall but may take longer.
info.llmText: These settings control the AI's response generation behavior:
info.temperatureText: Controls creativity. Lower values (0.0-0.3) produce focused, consistent answers. Higher values (0.7-1.0) generate more creative, varied responses.
info.reasoningText: Controls how much the model 'thinks' before responding. Higher effort produces more thorough answers but takes longer to generate.
info.tip1: Start with default settings and adjust one parameter at a time to understand its effect
info.tip2: Use Hybrid retrieval mode for most use cases - it provides the best balance
info.tip3: Enable semantic ranker for better relevance when searching complex documents
info.tip4: Lower temperature for factual questions, higher for creative or brainstorming tasks

tooltips.enhancePrompt: Enhance prompt - Rewrite to improve clarity and context

helpTexts.promptTemplate: Overrides the prompt used to generate the answer based on the question and search results. To append to existing prompt instead of replace whole prompt, start your prompt with '>>>'.
helpTexts.temperature: Sets the temperature of the request to the LLM that generates the answer. Higher temperatures result in more creative responses, but they may be less grounded.
helpTexts.seed: Sets a seed to improve the reproducibility of the model's responses. The seed can be any integer.
helpTexts.searchScore: Sets a minimum score for search results coming back from Azure AI search. The score range depends on whether you're using hybrid (default), vectors only, or text only.
helpTexts.rerankerScore: Sets a minimum score for search results coming back from the semantic reranker. The score always ranges between 0-4. The higher the score, the more semantically relevant the result is to the question.
helpTexts.retrieveNumber: Sets the number of search results to retrieve from Azure AI search. More results may increase the likelihood of finding the correct answer, but may lead to the model getting 'lost in the middle'.
helpTexts.agenticReasoningEffort: Controls the amount of reasoning the agent uses while planning retrieval subqueries. Higher effort can improve recall at the cost of additional latency and tokens.
helpTexts.includeCategory: Specifies a category to include in the search results. There are no categories used in the default data set.
helpTexts.excludeCategory: Specifies a category to exclude from the search results. There are no categories used in the default data set.
helpTexts.useSemanticReranker: Enables the Azure AI Search semantic ranker, a model that re-ranks search results based on semantic similarity to the user's query.
helpTexts.useQueryRewriting: Enables Azure AI Search query rewriting, a process that modifies the user's query to improve search results. Requires semantic ranker to be enabled.
helpTexts.reasoningEffort: Sets the reasoning effort for the LLM. Higher values result in more reasoning, but may take longer to generate a response. The default is medium.
helpTexts.useSemanticCaptions: Sends semantic captions to the LLM instead of the full search result. A semantic caption is extracted from a search result during the process of semantic ranking.
helpTexts.suggestFollowupQuestions: Asks the LLM to suggest follow-up questions based on the user's query.
helpTexts.textEmbeddings: When selected, search will use embeddings from the text-only embeddings model of extracted text chunks.
helpTexts.imageEmbeddings: When selected, search will use embeddings from the multimodal embeddings model of extracted images.
helpTexts.llmTextInputs: When selected, text content from the search results will be sent to the LLM as context.
helpTexts.llmImageInputs: When selected, images from the search results will be sent to the LLM as context.
helpTexts.retrievalMode: Sets the retrieval mode for the Azure AI Search query. `Vectors + Text (Hybrid)` uses a combination of vector search and full text search, `Vectors` uses only vector search, and `Text` uses only full text search. Hybrid is generally optimal.
helpTexts.streamChat: Continuously streams the response to the chat UI as it is generated.
helpTexts.useOidSecurityFilter: Filter search results based on the authenticated user's OID.
helpTexts.useGroupsSecurityFilter: Filter search results based on the authenticated user's groups.
helpTexts.useAgenticKnowledgeBase: Use agentic retrieval from Azure AI Search for multi-query planning. Always uses semantic ranker.
helpTexts.useWebSource: Augment retrieval with web search results alongside your indexed data set.
helpTexts.useSharePointSource: Augment retrieval with SharePoint content alongside your indexed data set.

news.title: Personalized News
news.subtitle: Stay informed with AI-curated news based on your interests
news.emptyDescription: Add topics you want to follow to see personalized news updates.
news.noNewsDescription: Click refresh to fetch the latest news for your topics.
news.preferencesDescription: Add up to 5 topics you want to follow. We will search for the latest news and provide AI-generated summaries.
news.noTermsConfigured: No topics configured yet. Add your first topic above.
news.preferencesInfo: News is refreshed automatically and cached for 1 hour to optimize performance and reduce costs.

info.title: How the News Dashboard Works
info.introText: The News Dashboard delivers AI-curated news summaries based on your personal interests. Instead of browsing multiple news sources, you get concise, relevant updates on topics that matter to you.
info.step1Text: Add up to 8 topics you want to follow. These can be anything from 'Artificial Intelligence' to 'Renewable Energy' or specific company names.
info.step2Text: Our system automatically searches for the latest news articles related to your topics. This happens daily at midnight and whenever you add a new topic.
info.step3Text: Each news article is processed by our AI to create a concise, informative summary. The AI extracts the key points so you can quickly understand the news without reading full articles.
info.step4Text: Your news feed shows all summaries organized by topic. Click on any card to see the full summary, source citations, and a link to the original article.
info.feature1: Up to 8 personalized topics - Follow what matters to you
info.feature2: AI-generated summaries - Get the key points quickly
info.feature3: Source citations - Verify information with original articles
info.feature4: Daily automatic updates - Fresh news every morning
info.feature5: Manual refresh - Get the latest news on demand
info.cachingText: News is cached for 24 hours to ensure fast loading and reduce API costs. The cache is automatically refreshed daily at midnight. You can also manually refresh to get the latest news immediately.
info.tip1: Use specific topics for more relevant results (e.g., 'Machine Learning' instead of just 'Technology')
info.tip2: Add topics in the language you want to receive news in
info.tip3: Check back daily for fresh updates on your topics

ideas.submitDescription: Share your idea with us. We will analyze it and provide feedback.
ideas.submitError: Failed to submit idea. Please try again.

info.title: How the Ideas Hub Works
info.introText: The Ideas Hub is a central platform where all employees can submit their ideas for using AI in the workplace. Your ideas are analyzed, evaluated, and prioritized transparently so that the best initiatives can be implemented.
info.goal1: Make good ideas visible - No more ideas getting lost in emails or meetings
info.goal2: Systematically leverage AI potential - Find and develop concrete AI use cases
info.goal3: Fair and transparent prioritization - Clear criteria for which ideas are pursued first
info.goal4: Active employee participation - Your perspective shapes our AI roadmap
info.step1Text: Describe the problem you want to solve, your proposed solution, who it affects, and what benefits you expect. You don't need a complete concept - just a clear description of the problem and expected benefit.
info.step2Text: After submission, our AI analyzes your idea and:
info.step2Item1: Creates a concise summary of your idea
info.step2Item2: Categorizes it by theme (e.g., Process Automation, Customer Support, Development)
info.step2Item3: Estimates potential benefits (time savings, affected employees, error reduction)
info.step2Item4: Assesses implementation complexity (integration effort, team changes required)
info.step3Text: Based on the analysis, each idea receives an Impact Score and a Feasibility Score, which determine its recommendation classification.
info.impactScoreText: Measures the potential benefit of your idea. Higher scores indicate greater positive impact. The score is calculated from:
info.impactFactor1: Time Savings (20%) - Hours saved per month
info.impactFactor2: Cost Reduction (25%) - Potential cost savings per year
info.impactFactor3: Quality Improvement (20%) - Improvement in quality metrics
info.impactFactor4: Employee Satisfaction (15%) - Impact on workplace satisfaction
info.impactFactor5: Scalability (20%) - Potential to scale across the organization
info.feasibilityScoreText: Measures how easily the idea can be implemented. Higher scores indicate easier implementation. The score is calculated from:
info.feasibilityFactor1: Implementation Effort (35%) - Estimated days to implement (less is better)
info.feasibilityFactor2: Risk Level (35%) - Low risk scores higher than high risk
info.feasibilityFactor3: Complexity (30%) - Overall technical and organizational complexity
info.classificationText: Based on the Impact and Feasibility scores, ideas are classified into four categories:
info.highLeverageDesc: High impact (70+) AND high feasibility (70+). These are top priority ideas that deliver significant value with manageable effort.
info.quickWinDesc: Medium+ impact (50+) AND high feasibility (70+). Easy to implement ideas that provide solid value quickly.
info.strategicDesc: High impact (70+) but lower feasibility (<70). Important initiatives that require more planning and resources.
info.evaluateDesc: Lower scores in both dimensions. These ideas need further review to determine their potential.
info.benefit1: Your ideas have a clear channel - Track the status and see how they are evaluated
info.benefit2: Fair, transparent evaluation - Understand why ideas are classified as they are
info.benefit3: Visibility and influence - Good ideas are visible across the organization
info.benefit4: Real improvements - More ideas mean more opportunities to reduce routine work through AI
info.fairnessText: The AI analyzes ideas to make them more comparable - it does not replace human judgment. Personal data is processed only as necessary and protected according to our privacy policies. Evaluation logic and criteria are documented and regularly reviewed to ensure fair and transparent decisions.
